content.question: Which of the following is true of women in the 1920s?

choices.label: A majority of women attended college.
Flappers became role models for women of all social strata.
Women’s political activism declined despite their gain of the right to vote.
Most women supported the Equal Rights Amendment.
The number of women in the medical and legal professions increased.

content.answer: Women’s political activism declined despite their gain of the right to vote.

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
